Part 313, issued pursuant to the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Respondents must maintain and make available to the FTC compliance-related documents for specified periods: five years for most compliance records and consumer complaints, and three years for materials used to prepare each security assessment.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); the Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule (Safeguards Rule), 16 C.F.R. provisions.title: Order Acknowledgment and Delivery
provisions.summary: Respondents must deliver a copy of this order to all current and future principals, officers, directors, managers, employees, agents, and representatives with relevant responsibilities — current personnel within 30 days of service, future personnel within 30 days of assuming their role.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); the Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule (Safeguards Rule), 16 C.F.R. provisions.summary: Respondent Stiles must notify the FTC within the required period of any discontinuance of her current business or employment, or any new affiliation with a business providing financial products or services, for a period of ten years.

provisions.title: Order Duration

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Misrepresentations About Privacy and Security
provisions.summary: Respondent must not misrepresent the extent to which it maintains and protects privacy, security, or confidentiality of covered information, including claims about message deletion, screenshot detection, data collection categories, or security measures.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Comprehensive Information Security Program
provisions.summary: Hotels and Resorts must establish, implement, and maintain a comprehensive information security program for 20 years, designed to protect the security, confidentiality, and integrity of Cardholder Data, including specific administrative, technical, and physical safeguards.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a), enforced through Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Cardholder Data Assessments
provisions.summary: Hotels and Resorts must annually obtain a written assessment of compliance with the Approved Standard, obtain additional certifications if noncompliant, and obtain a forensic investigator report following any large Breach, for up to 20 years after entry of the Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a), enforced through Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Order Acknowledgements
provisions.summary: Wyndham Worldwide Corporation, Wyndham Hotel Group LLC, and Hotels and Resorts must submit acknowledgements of receipt of this Order and deliver copies to subsidiaries, officers, employees, and other relevant personnel.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a), enforced through Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Wyndham Worldwide Corporation, Wyndham Hotel Group LLC, and Hotels and Resorts must each submit an initial compliance report one year after entry and ongoing compliance notices within 14 days of any relevant structural or contact changes for 10 years.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a), enforced through Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Wyndham Worldwide Corporation, Wyndham Hotel Group LLC, and Hotels and Resorts must maintain all materials relied upon to prepare each Assessment for three years after preparation of that Assessment and make them available to the Commission upon request.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a), enforced through Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The Commission is authorized to seek civil discovery using Federal Rules of Civil Procedure to monitor compliance, and may use compulsory process under the FTC Act; this Part applies as long as Defendants have obligations under Parts I or II, plus three years thereafter.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a), enforced through Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Wyndham Worldwide Corporation and Wyndham Hotel Group, LLC Parent Obligations
provisions.summary: Wyndham Worldwide Corporation and Wyndham Hotel Group LLC must ensure Hotels and Resorts complies with this Order for as long as they hold Hotels and Resorts as a subsidiary, but no longer than 20 years; their obligations cease immediately if Hotels and Resorts is no longer their subsidiary.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a), enforced through Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Retention of Jurisdiction
provisions.summary: The Court retains and has exclusive jurisdiction over this matter for purposes of modification and enforcement of this Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a), enforced through Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: GLB Rule Violations
provisions.summary: Respondent and all persons acting in concert with it must not violate any provision of the Standards for Safeguarding Consumer Information Rule (16 C.F.R. Part 314).
provisions.legal_authority: Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 314, issued pursuant to Title I of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley (GLB) Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6801 et seq.; violations enforced through the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6805(a)(7)

provisions.title: Mandated Data Security Program
provisions.summary: Each Covered Business must establish, implement, and maintain a comprehensive data security program protecting Covered Information, meeting numerous specific minimum requirements.
provisions.legal_authority: Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 314, issued pursuant to Title I of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley (GLB) Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6801 et seq.; violations enforced through the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6805(a)(7)

provisions.title: Data Security Assessments by a Third Party
provisions.summary: Respondent must obtain initial and biennial third-party assessments of each Covered Business's Data Security Program from a qualified, independent assessor, with specific reporting and submission requirements.
provisions.legal_authority: Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 314, issued pursuant to Title I of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley (GLB) Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6801 et seq.; violations enforced through the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6805(a)(7)

provisions.title: Cooperation with Third Party Information Security Assessor
provisions.summary: Respondent must fully cooperate with the Assessor by disclosing all material facts without misrepresentation, and providing all relevant information and materials in its possession.
provisions.legal_authority: Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 314, issued pursuant to Title I of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley (GLB) Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6801 et seq.; violations enforced through the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6805(a)(7)

provisions.title: Annual Certification
provisions.summary: Respondent must provide the Commission with annual certifications from a senior corporate manager or officer confirming compliance with the Order, awareness of no uncorrected material noncompliance, and a description of any Covered Incidents.
provisions.legal_authority: Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 314, issued pursuant to Title I of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley (GLB) Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6801 et seq.; violations enforced through the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6805(a)(7)

provisions.title: Covered Incident Reports
provisions.summary: Respondent must submit a report to the Commission within ten days of first notifying any government entity of a Covered Incident, including specified details about the incident and remediation steps.
provisions.legal_authority: Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 314, issued pursuant to Title I of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley (GLB) Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6801 et seq.; violations enforced through the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6805(a)(7)

provisions.title: Acknowledgments of the Order
provisions.summary: Respondent must acknowledge receipt of the Order, deliver copies to relevant personnel and entities, and obtain signed acknowledgments of receipt.
provisions.legal_authority: Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 314, issued pursuant to Title I of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley (GLB) Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6801 et seq.; violations enforced through the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6805(a)(7)

provisions.title: Compliance Reports and Notices
provisions.summary: Respondent must submit an initial compliance report one year after the Order, and timely notices of changes in contact information, organizational structure, or bankruptcy proceedings.
provisions.legal_authority: Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 314, issued pursuant to Title I of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley (GLB) Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6801 et seq.; violations enforced through the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6805(a)(7)

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Respondent must create specified records for twenty years after the Order issuance date and retain each record for five years, unless otherwise specified.
provisions.legal_authority: Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 314, issued pursuant to Title I of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley (GLB) Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6801 et seq.; violations enforced through the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6805(a)(7)

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The Commission is authorized to monitor Respondent's compliance by requesting reports and records, communicating directly with and interviewing Respondent's personnel, and using all other lawful means including undercover methods.

provisions.title: Order Effective Dates
provisions.summary: The Order is effective upon publication on the FTC's website and terminates on December 22, 2041, or twenty years from the most recent date the Commission files a complaint alleging a violation, whichever is later.

provisions.title: Prohibition on Misrepresentations
provisions.summary: Respondent must not misrepresent its privacy or cybersecurity protections for student information, or misrepresent the timeframe in which it will notify impacted individuals and school districts of a data breach.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Deletion of Unnecessary Personal Information
provisions.summary: Respondent must delete Covered Information that is no longer necessary to provide the contracted services or upon customer request.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Data Retention Schedule
provisions.summary: Respondent must publish and comply with a documented data retention schedule explaining the purposes for collecting personal information, the specific business needs for retaining it, and a timeframe for deletion.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Comprehensive Information Security Program
provisions.summary: Respondent must establish and implement a comprehensive written information security program that addresses the security, availability, confidentiality, and integrity of Covered Information, including strict access controls, multi-factor authentication, periodic access reviews, data inventory and classification, and periodic briefings to the Board.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Independent Third-Party Security Assessments
provisions.summary: Respondent must obtain an initial independent third-party information security assessment and then biennial assessments throughout the 10-year order period.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Truthful Disclosure to Assessors
provisions.summary: Respondent must not misrepresent or conceal material facts from independent third-party assessors conducting security assessments required by the Order.

provisions.title: Annual CISO Certifications
provisions.summary: Respondent's Chief Information Security Officer must submit annual written certifications to the FTC confirming that the information security program has been implemented and that there is no uncorrected material noncompliance.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Covered Incident Notification to FTC
provisions.summary: Respondent must notify the FTC whenever it notifies any U.S. federal, state, or local government entity of a data breach or unauthorized exposure of consumers' personal information.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Order Distribution and Acknowledgment
provisions.summary: Respondent must distribute copies of the Order to officers, directors, and employees with relevant responsibilities and obtain signed acknowledgments of receipt.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Respondent must file written compliance reports with the FTC within specified timeframes after the Order becomes final and upon request.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Respondent must create and retain documents necessary to demonstrate compliance with the Order for a specified retention period.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: FTC Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The FTC retains the right to access Respondent's facilities, records, and personnel to monitor compliance with the Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Order Duration
provisions.summary: The Order terminates ten years from the date of its issuance, subject to extension if a compliance violation complaint is filed.

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Misrepresentations
provisions.summary: Respondent and all persons acting with it must not misrepresent, expressly or by implication, their secure software development practices or the protection of consumers' financial assets.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Mandated Information Security Program
provisions.summary: Respondent must establish, implement, and maintain a comprehensive information security program designed to protect consumers' financial assets against loss from theft or unauthorized access, satisfying numerous specific sub-requirements.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Information Security Assessments by a Third Party
provisions.summary: Respondent must obtain initial and biennial independent third-party assessments of its Information Security Program, following specific requirements for assessor qualifications, reporting periods, assessment content, and submission to the Commission.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Cooperation with Third Party Information Security Assessor
provisions.summary: Respondent must fully cooperate with the third-party Assessor by providing all relevant information, network and IT asset access, and disclosing all material facts without misrepresentation.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Annual Certification
provisions.summary: Respondent's CEO must annually certify to the Commission that Respondent has established, implemented, and maintained the Order's requirements and is not aware of any uncorrected or undisclosed material noncompliance.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Return of Recovered Assets to Users
provisions.summary: Respondent must make available approximately $37.5 million in recovered assets to consumers via bounty, recovery bridge, or court-ordered process; provide website notice for 11 months; complete return of remaining assets within one year; and report on the refund program under penalty of perjury.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Acknowledgments of the Order
provisions.summary: Respondent must submit its own acknowledgment of receipt of the Order, deliver copies to principals, officers, relevant employees and agents, and future personnel, and obtain signed acknowledgments within 30 days.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Compliance Reports and Notices
provisions.summary: Respondent must file a sworn compliance report one year after issuance, notify the Commission within 14 days of changes to contact points or organizational structure, and notify the Commission within 14 days of any bankruptcy filing.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Respondent must create and retain for 5 years specified records including accounting records, personnel records, consumer complaints, representations about security practices, Assessment materials, law enforcement communications, and all records necessary to demonstrate full compliance.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The Commission may monitor Respondent's compliance by requiring additional reports or records within 10 days of written request, interviewing Respondent's personnel, and using all other lawful means including undercover methods.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Order Effective Dates
provisions.summary: The Order is final and effective upon publication on the FTC's website and will terminate 10 years from issuance, or 10 years from the most recent date the Commission files a complaint alleging any violation of the Order in federal court, whichever is later.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act
